intro: Diascia dissecta, commonly known as the fringed sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its showy, bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and has slender, branching stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Diascia dissecta thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
